TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BaseDataListDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner implements class System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider, class System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for components that provide design-time support in a designer host for Web server controls that are derived from the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a designer host, when the user switches from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes a control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> abstract class is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When the user switches back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The BaseDataListDesigner abstract class serves as a base class for components that provide design-time support for controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> in a designer host.
The BaseDataListDesigner class properties provide the following functionality:
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataKeyField%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataMember%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataSource%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataSourceID%2A> properties provide access to the corresponding properties of the associated control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataSourceDesigner%2A> property provides access to the designer of the data source of the associated control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DesignerView%2A> property gets the default view of the data source.
The BaseDataListDesigner class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.InvokePropertyBuilder%2A> method invokes a component editor for the control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to add, remove, or shadow design-time properties of the associated control.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetDesignTimeDataSource%2A> method generates an object that can be used as a data source at design time. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method gets the data source from the container of the associated control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> method gets the data source from the control container, resolved to a specific data member. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetTemplateContainerDataSource%2A> method gets the data source of the template container.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method is called when there is a change to the associated control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method is called when the associated control data source has changed. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the associated control data source changes. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnAutoFormatApplied%2A> method is called when an automatic formatting scheme has been applied.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnStylesChanged%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnTemplateEditingVerbsChanged%2A> methods can be overridden to implement functionality that should occur when an associated control style has changed or when the designer template-editing verbs have changed, respectively. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.OnPropertyBuilder%2A> method handles the property-builder event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> class when it creates the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ActionLists property creates an empty <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object and adds the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is returned by the ActionLists base property to this <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object. Then it adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, and then returns this <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data key field of the associated control.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataKeyField%2A> value of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataKeyField property provides access from the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataKeyField%2A> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataKeyField%2A> indicates the primary key of the data source that is bound to the associated control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data member field of the associated control.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> value of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataMember property provides access from the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> indicates the table or element of the data source that is bound to the associated control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data source property of the associated control.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> value of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataSource property provides access from the designer to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> property of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer of the data source, when one is selected for data binding.
Docs.value: The designer for the data source of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataSourceDesigner property returns the designer for the data source of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. The designer object implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceDesigner> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the designer's version of the data source ID property and is used to shadow the corresponding property of the associated control.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that is the data source ID of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting the designer's DataSourceID property causes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSourceID%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated control to be set. If the DataSourceID is set to a <xref:System.String>, indicating a new data source is to be defined, a **Create Data Source** dialog box is displayed. If the DataSourceID is set to a <xref:System.String> indicating there is no data source, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSourceID%2A> is set to an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control.
Docs.value: The representing the default view of the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DesignerView property gets the default view of the data source that is bound to the associated control by passing the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataMember%2A> property to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.GetView%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner> object. If no view is returned or the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataMember%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.GetViewNames%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner> is used to get the view names and the first view name is used to get the default view.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the designer and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class has a <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property that implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost> interface, the Dispose method disconnects the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost.LoadComplete> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner> object.
If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService> method, the Dispose disconnects the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentAdded>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentRemoving>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentRemoved> events. The Dispose also disconnects the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.DataSourceChanged> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner.SchemaRefreshed> events of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> object. It finally calls the Dispose base method.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource (int minimumRows, out bool dummyDataSource);
.method familyhidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource(int32 minimumRows, bool dummyDataSource) cil managed

Docs.param: The minimum number of rows of sample data that the data source should contain.
if the returned data source contains dummy data; if the returned data source contains data from an actual data source.
Docs.summary: Generates an object that can be used as a data source at design time.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface that serves as a data source for use at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetDesignTimeDataSource method attempts to construct a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object from the data source that is defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataMember%2A> properties. If this is not possible, it creates a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> from dummy data.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource (System.Collections.IEnumerable selectedDataSource, int minimumRows, out bool dummyDataSource);

.method familyhidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource(class System.Collections.IEnumerable selectedDataSource, int32 minimumRows, bool dummyDataSource) cil managed

Docs.param: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> that is used as a template for the data format.
The minimum number of rows of sample data that the data source data should contain.
if the returned data source contains dummy data; if the returned data source contains data from an actual data source.
Docs.summary: Generates an object that can be used as a data source at design time.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface that serves as a data source for use at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetDesignTimeDataSource method attempts to construct a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object from the data source that is specified by the `selectedDataSource` parameter. If this is not possible, it creates a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> from dummy data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetResolvedSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container, resolved to a specific data member.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> of the associated control, resolved to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> parameter; otherwise, if a data source is not found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeData.GetSelectedDataSource%2A> method to construct a data source from the object that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> properties of the associated control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetSelectedDataSource() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the data source component from the associated control container.
Docs.returns: An object implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing the design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> property of the associated control; otherwise, if a data source is not found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetSelectedDataSource method uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignTimeData.GetSelectedDataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to construct a data source from the object that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> property of the associated control derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerable GetTemplateContainerDataSource(string templateName) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Use of this method is not recommended because template editing is handled in ControlDesigner. To support template editing expose template data in the TemplateGroups property and call SetViewFlags(ViewFlags.TemplateEditing, true). http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.param: A <xref:System.String> that specifies the name of the template for which to get the data source.
Docs.summary: Gets the data source of the template's container.
Docs.returns: An object that implements an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface containing a design-time <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetTemplateContainerDataSource method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource%2A> method to construct a data source from the object that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A> properties of the associated control derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: A control derived from the , which implements an .
Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The Initialize connects to the design-time data source and updates the design-time markup. If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent.Site%2A> property implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService> interface, the Initialize connects the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentAdded>, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentRemoving>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentRemoved> events.
The `component` parameter is the control, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList>, that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void InvokePropertyBuilder(int32 initialPage) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the page with which to initialize the component editor.
Docs.summary: Invokes a component editor for the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The InvokePropertyBuilder method creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridComponentEditor> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListComponentEditor> object, and then invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor.EditComponent%2A> method of the component editor.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void OnAutoFormat (object sender, EventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig instance void OnAutoFormat(object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Use of this method is not recommended because the AutoFormat dialog is launched by the designer host. The list of available AutoFormats is exposed on the ControlDesigner in the AutoFormats property. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Handles the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnAutoFormat method is obsolete and has no functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnAutoFormatApplied(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat appliedAutoFormat) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that defines a style.
Docs.summary: Called when an automatic formatting scheme has been applied to the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The OnAutoFormatApplied method is called when a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object is applied to the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormat> object defines a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatStyle> object that is applied to the control.
A designer can override the OnAutoFormatApplied to inspect properties of the control or to take some other action.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnComponentChanged (object sender, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnComponentChanged(object sender, class System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Object> that is the source of the event.
A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Called when there is a change to the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnComponentChanged method is called when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class executes. Typically, this is in response to a property change on the control (for example, a **Properties** grid change). If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner.DataSource%2A> object to which the control is bound is changed, the control is redrawn on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnDataSourceChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the data source for the associated control has changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnDataSourceChanged base method connects the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class to the current data source, and if that is different from the data source to which the control was connected, the method updates the design-time markup.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void OnPropertyBuilder (object sender, EventArgs e);
.method familyhidebysig instance void OnPropertyBuilder(object sender, class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Object> that is the source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the property-builder event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnPropertyBuilder method invokes a component editor for the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class. It creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridComponentEditor> or <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataListComponentEditor> object, and then invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListComponentEditor.EditComponent%2A> method of the component editor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSchemaRefreshed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless the designer is in template-editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the OnSchemaRefreshed method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> control to reflect the data source change.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void OnStylesChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Can be overridden to implement functionality that should occur when a style of the associated control has changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnStylesChanged method can serve as notification that a style of the associated control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnTemplateEditingVerbsChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Can be overridden to implement functionality that should occur when the designer template-editing verbs have changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnTemplateEditingVerbsChanged method can be implemented to perform additional processing, such recording that a change has occurred, when the template-editing verbs change.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add additional properties to the display in the **Properties** grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the **Properties** grid.
For controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList> class, the PreFilterProperties creates design-time properties to shadow the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataMember%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataKeyField%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataSourceID%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.CanRefreshSchema%2A>.
Docs.value: if the schema can be refreshed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.RefreshSchema(bool preferSilent) cil managed

Docs.param: to disable data-binding events until after the schema has been refreshed; to enable the events.
Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.RefreshSchema%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider.Schema%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataBindingSchemaProvider> interface.
